summary: Elizabeth A Kilker is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in 1977. Her name appears on multiple payroll certifications for the months of January, October, and November 1977. These documents list her name alongside other committee staff, social security numbers, positions, and salary information. The documents suggest she was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Elizabeth A Kilker's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided documents, her presence on the payroll indicates she contributed to the committee's work.
